name: 123 Notetaker AI Free
summary_and_recommendation: 123 Notetaker AI Free scores 58 points (Medium Risk) primarily due to unclear training data policies, lack of enterprise controls, and absence of compliance certifications. The tool processes sensitive meeting data including audio/video and stores it in the US with data retention under 30 days. While it has basic security practices, it lacks enterprise-grade controls and major compliance certifications. Recommend: Approve with restrictions for low-sensitivity meetings only, require explicit consent from all participants, and prohibit use with confidential/PHI data.
primary_use_case: Meeting transcription and note-taking for Microsoft Teams
data_classification: Meeting content, audio/video recordings, user identifiers
documentation_tier: Tier 2: Private enterprise documentation via Microsoft certification
assessment_notes: Good confidence level due to detailed Microsoft certification documentation. Some gaps in specific privacy policy details as direct policy URL was not accessible.

recommendations.title: Restrict to low-sensitivity meetings only
recommendations.description: Due to unclear training data policies and lack of enterprise controls, limit usage to meetings with public or marketing content only

recommendations.title: Require explicit participant consent
recommendations.description: Implement process requiring all meeting participants to explicitly consent before 123 Notetaker AI is activated

recommendations.title: Monitor for enterprise alternatives
recommendations.description: Evaluate enterprise-grade alternatives with stronger compliance certifications and data governance controls

detailed_assessment.summary_and_recommendation: 123 Notetaker AI Free scores 58 points (Medium Risk) primarily due to unclear training data policies, lack of enterprise controls, and absence of compliance certifications. The tool processes sensitive meeting data including audio/video and stores it in the US with data retention under 30 days. While it has basic security practices, it lacks enterprise-grade controls and major compliance certifications. Recommend: Approve with restrictions for low-sensitivity meetings only, require explicit consent from all participants, and prohibit use with confidential/PHI data.

geographic_control.justification: 'Known secure regions (US, EU) with contracts'. Microsoft documentation confirms data is stored in 'United States of America' with established data management processes, representing a known secure region with contractual protections.

encryption_standards.justification: 'Basic Encryption - TLS encryption in transit + standard encryption at rest + limited encryption details published'. Microsoft documentation confirms 'TLS 1.1 or higher' support but provides limited details on encryption specifications.

data_retention.justification: 'Clear Limited Retention - Specific retention periods documented (â‰¤90 days) + automatic deletion procedures + user deletion controls'. Microsoft documentation states 'Less than 30days' retention after account termination with established data retention and disposal processes.

model_training.justification: ' Default training use with difficult opt-out'. Microsoft documentation does not specify whether customer data is used for AI model training or if opt-out mechanisms exist. For AI-powered transcription tools, this typically indicates default training use.

data_sharing.justification: 'Broad sharing or unclear sharing practices'. Microsoft documentation states 'No' to third-party transfers but lacks detailed disclosure of data sharing practices, creating uncertainty about sharing scope.

admin_management.justification: 'Limited Controls - User visibility only + minimal management capabilities'. Microsoft documentation shows no enterprise admin controls or centralized management capabilities for the free version.

audit_capabilities.justification: 'Basic Auditing - Limited logs + manual export only + basic usage statistics'. Microsoft documentation confirms event logging but limited organizational audit capabilities for the free version.

integration.justification: 'Limited Integration - SSO only + no provisioning + minimal enterprise features'. Microsoft documentation shows no SSO integration ('No' to Microsoft identity platform) and limited enterprise features for the free version.

regulatory_violations.justification: 'Compliance Gaps - Generic privacy policy + no compliance certifications + documented violations or regulatory warnings in past 2 years'. Microsoft documentation shows 'No' to all major compliance certifications (SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPAA, FedRAMP).

data_processing_transparency.justification: 'Basic Transparency - General data processing description + retention periods stated + some third-party relationships disclosed'. Microsoft documentation provides clear data processing descriptions and retention periods.

documentation_and_support.justification: 'Good Documentation - Clear privacy policy + basic security documentation + responsive support + annual transparency reports'. Microsoft certification provides comprehensive security documentation with detailed self-assessment responses.
